text: The city of Ottawa, Canada held municipal elections on December 1, 1930. ==Mayor of Ottawa== Controller John J. Allen was elected as mayor without opposition, after mayor Frank H. Plant decided to retire after running as a Conservative in the 1930 Canadian federal election. {| class="wikitable" |- style="background-color:#E9E9E9" ! style="width: 200px"|Candidate ! style="width: 50px"|Votes ! style="width: 40px"|% |- |John J. Allen |colspan="2"| Acclaimed |} ==Ottawa Board of Control== All three incumbent controllers were defeated as voters opted to elect a new slate of controllers. Notably, no French Canadians were elected to the Board of Control, and it was thought that this was the first election to have all four elected controllers be Protestants. Only one incumbent councillor (Nelson J. Lacasse) went down in defeat.
